column5: YOU WILL FIND in the DIARIES a LOT of POLITICS AND EVEN MORE CATS     THE PERSON who MAKES the FIRST COMMENT WILL GET TWO CATS EVERY PERSON WHO COMMENTS WILL GET A CAT     RULES IN THE DIARY WHEN YOU FIND SOMETHING in the DIARY that you LIKE YOU CAN REPOST IT AS COMMENT in the DIARY  PRESIDENT JOE BIDEN President Biden is on the fastest pace for judicial confirmations in a first presidential term in more than 50 years. https://t.co/TJjx4lSSph  President Biden on the SCOTUS decision: "Today's decision makes it all the more imperative to continue the fight for the For the People Act and the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act to restore and expand voting protections."  Biden: The families of the condo collapse victims are "going through hell.""I spent a lot of time with the families a whole lot of time. I apologize for taking so long to get here because I thought it was important to speak to every single person who wanted to speak to me."  President Biden on the families of the condo collapse victims: "Jill and I wanted them to know that we're with them and the country's with them. Our message today is that we're here for you as one nation. As one nation. And that's the message we communicated."  SPEAKER PELOSI Breaking: Speaker Pelosi has just named Liz Cheney to the Jan. 6 select committee.  News from Pelosi: House Homeland Security Chair Bennie Thompson will serve as the chair of the Jan. 6 select committee.Other committee members: Reps. Schiff Raskin Lofgren Luira Murphy Aguilar. The Republican is Rep. Liz Cheney.  KEVIN MCCARTHY Punchbowl News: During a closed-door meeting with freshman House Republicans Kevin McCarthy made a threat:If any Republican accepts an appointment from Speaker Nancy Pelosi to the Jan. 6 select committee they will be stripped of their committee assignments.  Kevin McCarthy won't answer questions about whether he thinks Trump is to blame for Jan. 6. He dodges multiple attempts from reporters.  LIZ CHENEY Liz Cheney: "I'm honored to have been named to serve on the January 6th select committee.""Those who are responsible for the attack need to be held accountable and this select committee will fulfill that responsibility in a professional expeditious and non-partisan manner."  Rep. Liz Cheney on the Jan. 6 select committee: "It'll be thorough it'll be professional it'll be serious and not— not partisan."  SUPREME COURT WASHINGTON (AP) -- Supreme Court upholds Arizona voting restrictions.  Justice Kagan dissenting: "Today the Court undermines Section 2 and the right it provides. The majority fears that the statute Congress wrote is too 'radical'—that it will invalidate too many state voting laws. So the majority writes its own set of rules limiting Section 2."  Justice Kagan dissenting: "What is tragic here is that the Court has (yet again) rewritten—in order to weaken—a statute that stands as a monument to America's greatness and protects against its basest impulses."  Justice Kagan dissenting: "By declaring some racially discriminatory burdens inconsequential and by refusing to subject asserted state interests to serious means-end scrutiny the majority enables voting discrimination."  Justice Kagan dissenting: "Arizona’s ballot-collection ban violates Section 2. The ban interacts with conditions on the ground—most crucially disparate access to mail service—to create unequal voting opportunities for Native Americans."  Justice Kagan in the last graf of her dissent:"This Court has no right to remake Section 2.""That law of all laws deserves the sweep and power Congress gave it. That law of all laws should not be diminished by this Court."  REP. NADLER & COHEN In response to the SCOTUS voting decision House Judiciary members Nadler and Cohen announce the Committee will "expeditiously complete its work on an updated John R. Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act and move to bring legislation to the House floor as quickly as possible."  HOUSE The House voted to approve the INVEST Act a $715 billion transportation and water infrastructure bill focused on improving and repairing roads bridges transit and rail and ensuring clean drinking water.The vote was 221-201. Just two Republicans voted with Democrats.  The House passed a comprehensive package of reforms to protect inspectors general from being fired or otherwise prevented from doing their jobs a measure inspired by Trump's pattern of ousting agency watchdogs who challenged him.https://t.co/bHjVeALj2C  OATH KEEPERS A Trump supporter who teamed up with Oath Keepers to storm the Capitol has testified before a grand jury and reached a plea deal with federal prosecutors in which he admits he entered into a conspiracy to obstruct the certification of Biden's win. https://t.co/NeAy2LkjL4  TRUMP New York prosecutors investigating the Trump Organization are scrutinizing cash bonuses as part of their focus on whether the company failed to pay taxes on benefits provided to some of its employees.https://t.co/G6PyKL63Pj  Trump Org. CFO Allen Weisselberg has surrendered to the Manhattan DA's office. https://t.co/1fXuTtKwGq  Jennifer Weisselberg the ex-daughter-in-law of Allen Weisselberg tells CNN that she "absolutely" believes the Trump Org. will be shut down.  Trump Org. CFO Allen Weisselberg has just been brought into court in handcuffs. @MSNBC  New on @MSNBC: Trump Org. CFO Allen Weisselberg has been charged with grand larceny in the second degree along with other charges.  New on @MSNBC: The Manhattan District Attorney has moved to secure Allen Weisselberg's passport as part of the terms of his release and they say Weisselberg is prepared to surrender his passport to D.A. investigators. Weisselberg has to ask the court's permission to travel.  Prosecutors described a 15-year tax scheme and said the charges include 15 felony counts including a scheme to defraud conspiracy grand larceny and falsifying business records.Prosecutors allege Weisselberg evaded taxes on $1.7 million of income. https://t.co/LXszvZt9yT  Breaking: The unsealed indictment against the Trump Organization and Trump Org. CFO Allen Weisselberg has been released. https://t.co/YqnCOgV9Rk  Prosecutors say they have digital drives with grand jury testimony bookkeeping records tax records statements of potential witnesses. https://t.co/LXszvZt9yT  There are references to an "Unindicted Co-conspirator #1."On or before April 5 2010 the Trump Corporation acting through its agent Unindicted Co-conspirator #1 underreported Allen Weisselberg's taxable income for the tax year 2009. https://t.co/xjEsLlFgr5  New York Attorney General Letitia James:"Today is an important marker in the ongoing criminal investigation of the Trump Organization and its CFO Allen Weisselberg.""This investigation will continue and we will follow the facts and the law wherever they may lead."  ARIZONA Why?Arizona Senate election auditors are keeping the ballots for now. It's unclear when the 2.1 million Maricopa County ballots will be returned.https://t.co/eVpYPZnzlp  NEW HAMPSHIRE A majority of the members of New Hampshire Republican Gov. Chris Sununu's diversity and inclusion council have resigned in protest after he signed a new law that restricts how public school teachers and other government employees can talk about racism.https://t.co/XmReHl1PYN
